metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31084 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: LDAP Account Manager (LAM) is a webfrontend for managing entries (e.g. users, groups, DHCP settings) stored in an LDAP directory. In versions prior to 8.0 There are cases where LAM instantiates objects from arbitrary classes. An attacker can inject the first constructor argument. This can lead to code execution if non-LAM classes are instantiated that execute code during object creation. This issue has been fixed in version 8.0.

criterions.comment: ldap-account-manager package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
